author: schone_wizard
content: i'm not sure if this is appropriate for this channel, but i've just run into a situation which i think warrents some thought.  I deposited to Spadina and thought all is well cause I saw the 'Deposit' event log.  Little did I realize that my deposits were in fact invalid.  How do we prevent this loss of funds and even more so, the inability to validate after such a mistake ?

author: schone_wizard
content: in my case I believe after using a client's auto deposit function thru geth, I simply forgot to add the testnet flag.  Which I realize isn't a real world scenario, but still it's concering you'd get a 'normal' deposit log statement on Eth1, yet be completely invalid on Eth2

author: protolambda
content: Best approach would be to prepare your deposit with an audited tool like the deposit-cli, and verifying the deposit before submitting it to deposit contract on eth1 with actual value.

author: schone_wizard
